p: The serum biochemical parameters can reflect the physiological and metabolic status of animals. These parameters can be altered by diet and environmental agents. Arise et al. (2009) reported that the administration of aqueous extract of eucalyptus in the feed of rats reduced the cholesterol and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol of serum. In the current study, also serum cholesterol concentration had tended to reduce linearly in birds fed different concentrations of EEO. Similarly, Chen et al. (2018) reported that the inclusion of polyphenols in eucalyptus leaves at 0.8 g/kg could reduce cholesterol content in egg yolk. In an in vitro study, Kladniew et al. (2014) observed that 1.8-cineole (as the main compound of the eucalyptus) could inhibit steps in cholesterol synthesis by blocking 3-hydroxy-3-methyl glutaryl-CoA reductase (the key indicator of the cholesterol biosynthesis pathway) levels. In vivo experiments also have shown that the possible mechanism for lowering the cholesterol synthesis by phytogenic products (ajwain, clove, and cinnamon essential oils) may be because of the inhibitory effects of its active compounds on the reductase enzyme 3-hydroxy 3-methylglutaryl-CoA or increased catabolism of lipoproteins ( Chowdhury et al., 2018b). In addition, part of the decrease in blood cholesterol may be related to well-known LAB activities following the improvement of intestinal microflora balance ( Ashayerizadeh et al., 2018:; Jazi et al., 2018b).
